data.event: The original county seat selected in 1843 was Oxford, but after a long struggle between contending factions it was moved to Fowler in 1874.
The current Benton County courthouse, located in Fowler, was designed by Gordon P. Randall of Chicago and built in 1874 by Levi L. Leach at a cost of $62,257.

event.title: had designed the Marshall County courthouse a few years earlier

data.event: Randall had designed the Marshall County courthouse a few years earlier.

event.title: 2008 the Benton County Wind Farm began

data.event: In 2008 the Benton County Wind Farm began operating with 87 1.5 MW wind turbines.
